description: Erection of rear dormer roof extension and installation of 2 nos front roof lights to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: The proposed roof extension amounts to development as defined in Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and therefore by virtue of Section 57 of the 1990 Act, requires planning permission. It has not been demonstrated, on the balance of probability, that the application would benefit from permitted development rights (Development within the curtilage of a dwellinghouse) under Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Notwithstanding the above reason for refusal, it has not demonstrated that the proposed roof extension would comply with Conditions B.2 (b)(i)(aa) and B.2 (b)(i)(bb) of Class B Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not demonstrated that the proposed window to the side elevation would comply with Conditions B.2 (c)(i) and (ii)  and C.2(a) and (b) of Class B Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not demonstrated that the proposed rooflights would comply with Paragraph C.1(b) of Class C Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
